newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso ends barely changed.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso ends barely changed.

text.p: The Philippine peso closed barely changed on Friday as the central bank kept up its defence of the local currency by selling dollars, traders said.
The peso settled at 28.99 to the dollar from the previous close of 29. Volume was at $59.3 million with the central bank accounting for about 3/4 of the sales at the rates of 28.99/29, traders said.
Traders said banks have started selling their dollars in compliance with the new ruling of the central bank cutting their long dollar positions to five percent from 10 percent of capital.
"But they were unloading to meet the pent-up demand of commercial clients," a trader said, forcing the central bank to also sell dollars to banks.
However, banks have started to sell dollars to clients at lower rates, encouraged by the fact the central bank was always in the market to sell dollars, one trader said.
In the parallel market, the dollar was being exchanged for pesos at a softer rate of 29.20/29.30 versus the previous day's 29.30/29.35.

But other traders said the pressure on the peso may not ease yet because of the import season which lasts up to October and the reluctance of exporters to sell their dollars because of the currency volatility persisting in the region.
